title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
The FTC has begun a probe into mental-health startup Cerebral, according to a letter the agency sent the company that was reviewed by The Wall Street Journal.

Biden is closing in on a decision to lift some tariffs on Chinese imports, as he looks for ways to address inflation and grapples with pressure from labor unions to keep the sanctions in place.

FedEx is boosting its dividend and adding board members under pressure from activist D.E. Shaw, moves that come shortly after Fred Smith stepped aside as CEO.

Caterpillar said it is moving its headquarters to Texas from the company's longtime Illinois base.

NextEra Energy said it plans to make most of its operations completely carbon-free by 2045.

Harold Hamm, the billionaire fracking pioneer, is looking to take Continental Resources private.

What's News: Business & Finance
